availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William Brown Read (Lawyer and State Senator)

body.p: Hodgenville, Kentucky, attorney and politician. Hardin County, Kentucky, native. Married S. R. Read. Member of the Senate of the Commonwealth of Kentucky from 1857 to 1865. Delegate to the Democratic National Conventions in Charleston, South Carolina, and Baltimore, Maryland, in 1860. Unsuccessful candidate for Lieutenant Governor of Kentucky in 1863. Delegate to the Democratic National Convention in Chicago, Illinois, in 1864.

ab.bibl: Biographical Directory of the United States Congress, “William Brown Read,” http://bioguide.congress.gov/scripts/biodisplay.pl?index=R000094. Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, LaRue County, Hodgenville, p. 150.
